title: The Jungle Book
author: Rudyard Kipling
description: A collection of stories about animals living in the Indian jungle.

title: Malgudi Days
author: R.K. Narayan
description: A collection of short stories set in the fictional town of Malgudi.

title: The God of Small Things
author: Arundhati Roy
description: A novel exploring the lives of twins in Kerala and their experiences.

title: Panchatantra
author: Vishnu Sharma
description: A collection of animal fables with moral lessons, originating in ancient India.

title: The White Tiger
author: Aravind Adiga
description: A novel depicting the life of a poor Indian driver who becomes an entrepreneur.

title: Midnight's Children
author: Salman Rushdie
description: A novel tracing the lives of individuals born at the moment of India's independence.

title: Raja Rasalu and Other Stories
author: Flora Annie Steel
description: A collection of Indian folktales and stories.

title: Untouchable
author: Mulk Raj Anand
description: A novel depicting the life and struggles of an untouchable boy in India.

title: Sita: An Illustrated Retelling of the Ramayana
author: Devdutt Pattanaik
description: A retelling of the epic Ramayana, focusing on the character of Sita.

title: The Inheritance of Loss
author: Kiran Desai
description: A novel exploring the lives of characters in a Himalayan village.

title: My Friend Flicka
author: Ruskin Bond
description: A story about a young boy and his relationship with a horse in the Indian hills.

title: The Guide
author: R.K. Narayan
description: A novel about a man who becomes a spiritual guide in a small town.

title: Malgudi Schooldays
author: R.K. Narayan
description: A collection of stories about the lives of schoolchildren in Malgudi.

title: The Mahabharata
author: Vyasa
description: One of the longest epic poems, narrating the story of the Mahabharata war.

title: The Room on the Roof
author: Ruskin Bond
description: A novel about a young boy's life in the hills of India.

title: The Great Indian Novel
author: Shashi Tharoor
description: A satirical novel that reimagines the Indian epic Mahabharata.

title: The Palace of Illusions
author: Chitra Banerjee Divakaruni
description: A retelling of the Mahabharata from the perspective of Draupadi.

title: Folktales of India
author: A.K. Ramanujan
description: A collection of folktales from various regions of India.

title: The Serpent's Revenge: Unusual Tales from the Mahabharata
author: Sudha Murty
description: A collection of lesser-known tales from the Mahabharata.

title: In Custody
author: Anita Desai
description: A novel about a man's journey to capture the essence of a famous poet.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: Although not set in India, this novel explores themes of friendship, redemption, and cultural identity.

title: Train to Pakistan
author: Khushwant Singh
description: A novel set during the Partition of India, depicting the impact on a village.

title: Two States: The Story of My Marriage
author: Chetan Bhagat
description: A novel about a couple from different Indian states navigating cultural differences.

title: The Blue Umbrella
author: Ruskin Bond
description: A story about a young girl and her treasured blue umbrella in the mountains.

title: The Lowland
author: Jhumpa Lahiri
description: A novel spanning generations and continents, exploring the lives of two brothers.

title: Shantaram
author: Gregory David Roberts
description: A novel based on the author's experiences as an escaped convict in Mumbai.

title: The Glass Palace
author: Amitav Ghosh
description: A novel spanning decades and continents, exploring the lives of characters in Burma and India.

title: The Hungry Tide
author: Amitav Ghosh
description: A novel set in the Sundarbans, depicting the lives of characters amidst nature and culture.

title: English, August: An Indian Story
author: Upamanyu Chatterjee
description: A novel about an urban man's experiences in a small town during his civil service.

title: Gitanjali
author: Rabindranath Tagore
description: A collection of poems by the Nobel laureate, reflecting his spiritual and artistic vision.

title: The Secret Garden
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
setting: Yorkshire, England (Though not Indian, this classic has a popular Indian adaptation)
description: A novel about a girl discovering a hidden garden and its healing powers.

title: Kanthapura
author: Raja Rao
description: A novel depicting the impact of Gandhian principles on a village during the Indian freedom movement.

title: Kim
author: Rudyard Kipling
description: A novel about an orphaned boy's adventures in India during the British Raj.

title: The White Mughals
author: William Dalrymple
description: A historical account of the cultural interactions between British and Indian elites during the 18th century.

title: The Last Mughal: The Fall of a Dynasty
author: William Dalrymple
description: A historical account of the Indian Rebellion of 1857 and the end of the Mughal dynasty.

title: The Shadow Lines
author: Amitav Ghosh
description: A novel exploring the interconnected lives of characters in India and Bangladesh.

title: The Guide
author: R.K. Narayan
description: A novel about a man who becomes a spiritual guide in a small town.

title: The Discovery of India
author: Jawaharlal Nehru
description: A historical work exploring India's rich cultural and political history.

title: The Oath of the Vayuputras
author: Amish Tripathi
description: The final book in the Shiva Trilogy, a retelling of ancient Indian epics.

title: The Rozabal Line
author: Ashwin Sanghi
description: A thriller involving the search for the tomb of Jesus Christ in India.

title: The Village by the Sea
author: Anita Desai
description: A novel about a young girl's determination to uplift her family's life in a fishing village.

title: The Sculptor and the Sandman
author: Pulkit Gupta
description: A fantasy novel exploring the magical journey of a sculptor and a sandman.

title: The Forest of Enchantments
author: Chitra Banerjee Divakaruni
description: A retelling of the Ramayana from the perspective of Sita.

title: The Zoya Factor
author: Anuja Chauhan
description: A romantic comedy novel centered around a woman considered to be a lucky charm for the Indian cricket team.

title: A Suitable Boy
author: Vikram Seth
description: A novel exploring the lives and relationships of characters in post-independence India.

title: The Immortals of Meluha
author: Amish Tripathi
description: The first book in the Shiva Trilogy, a reimagining of the life of Lord Shiva.

title: One Part Woman
author: Perumal Murugan
description: A novel exploring the life of a childless couple and their struggles in a traditional society.

title: The Ministry of Utmost Happiness
author: Arundhati Roy
description: A novel weaving together multiple narratives and characters across India.

title: Delhi: A Novel
author: Khushwant Singh
description: A novel depicting the history, culture, and society of Delhi.

title: The Thirteenth Day: A Story of the Kurukshetra War
author: Aditya Iyengar
description: A retelling of the events of the thirteenth day of the Kurukshetra War from the Mahabharata.
